com.revolsys.ui.web.servlet
Class Log4jServletContextListener

java.lang.Object
  com.revolsys.ui.web.servlet.Log4jServletContextListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventListener, javax.servlet.ServletContextListener
public class Log4jServletContextListener
extends Object
implements javax.servlet.ServletContextListener

The Log4jServletContextListener class uses the ContextClassLoaderRepositorySelector to maintain a separate Log4j configuration for a servlet context and to load the logging configuration from the log4j.xml file specified by the log4jXmlLocation context-param (or /WEB-INF/log4j.xml if not specified).

Version:
1.0
Author:
Paul Austin

 void contextDestroyed(javax.servlet.ServletContextEvent event)
          Clean up the context by removing the logging configuration for the current context.
 void contextInitialized(javax.servlet.ServletContextEvent event)
          Initialize the logging for context by creating a new heirarchy for the current thread context class context and loading the configuration from the log4jXmlLocation context-param.

public void contextInitialized(javax.servlet.ServletContextEvent event)
Initialize the logging for context by creating a new heirarchy for the current thread context class context and loading the configuration from the log4jXmlLocation context-param.
